title: The World Bank Doctoral Research and Policy Engagement Consultation
abstractText:
The project involves direct engagement of doctoral researchers with a key user of research - the World Bank - which has stated that engagement with researchers is wanted and warranted. One avenue of engagement is dialogue with young career researchers, such as those conducting doctoral studies on the World Bank and related development issues. 

The Centre for the Study of Globalisation and Regionalisation (CSGR) project involves three forms of engagement:

  • Panel presentation at the Annual Bank Conference on Development Economics (ABCDE) in Tokyo May 2006;
  • Launch of a book in CSGR book series The World Bank and Governance: A Decade of Reform and Reaction (editors: Diane Stone and Christopher Wright) and a one-day workshop in September 2006 in tandem with the Annual Meetings of the World Bank and International Monetary Fund, Singapore;
  • Enhancement and widening of a community of doctoral students researching the World Bank via an email discussion group.

CSGR partners include the Researcher’s Alliance on Development (RAD), an international scholarly network, and the World Bank’s External Affairs Vice Presidency. The activities represent innovative training provision bringing early career researchers into direct contact with major political and economic institution.
